alert.note: Alert for Anoka; Hennepin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 10:43AM CDT until May 20 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Mississippi River At Hwy 169 at Champlin affecting Anoka and Hennepin Counties. .Heavy rainfall over the past week is causing rapid runoff through the Mississippi River tributaries and eventually the Mississippi River itself. The Mississippi River is expected to reach Minor flood stage at Champlin by Sunday evening. For the Mississippi River...including Royalton 4NW, St. Cloud, Hwy 169 at Champlin, Hwy 610 @ Brooklyn Pk, Fridley abv 37th Ave NE, St. Paul, Hastings L/D 2, Red Wing L/D 3, Red Wing...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River At Hwy 169 at Champlin. * WHEN...Until Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.5 feet, Champlin - flooding begins on West River Parkway upstream from gage * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 930 AM CDT Saturday, the stage was 10.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 12.7 feet Monday evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.7 feet on 04/16/1960. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
